result.reason: RDP fullscreen used screen.Bounds logical pixels instead of physical pixels, causing understated resolution on high-DPI monitors; fix is to scale by DeviceDpi/96.
result.approach: Multiply screen.Bounds dimensions by ResolutionScalingFactor (DeviceDpi/96f) when setting DesktopWidth/Height for fullscreen connections.

attempts.raw_output:
The issue was already fixed in this repo (commits `844658b9f`, `3bddefea6`). The root cause: `screen.Bounds` returns logical (DPI-virtualized) pixels when DPI-unaware, so fullscreen RDP got a lower-than-native resolution. Fix: multiply by `ResolutionScalingFactor` (DPI/96) to get physical pixels.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"RDP fullscreen used screen.Bounds logical pixels instead of physical pixels, causing understated resolution on high-DPI monitors; fix is to scale by DeviceDpi/96.","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs"],"approach":"Multiply screen.Bounds dimensions by ResolutionScalingFactor (DeviceDpi/96f) when setting DesktopWidth/Height for fullscreen connections."}
```
